short_instructions.https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s: Get the bird to the bad pig!
Fix the code to get the bird to the pig.
Fix the code to get the bird to the pig!
REMOVE a block to get the bird to the pig!
Try this one yourself from the beginning.
Move one way, then another to get the bird to the pig!
Figure out what is missing and then add blocks to get the bird to the pig!
Solve this level and get the bird to the pig!
Debug this level by adding blocks to get the bird to the pig!
Challenge: Go around the TNT to get the bird to the pig!
Move one way, then another to get the bird to the pig.
Get that pig!
Get the pig any way you can!
Something is wrong here. Help fix the code to get the bird to the pig!
Trace the path to lead the bird to the pig. Avoid TNT or feathers will fly!
Move Laurel around and get as much treasure as you can!
Get all three piles to pass this level.
Fix Laurel's path to get all of this treasure.
Use what you learned to get all of the treasure.
Add blocks to this code to get all of the treasure.
What should you add to this code to get all of the treasure?
Write code to get all of this treasure.
**Challenge:** The treasure goes all the way up these stairs!  Write the code to help Laurel get it all.
Help Laurel get all of the treasure along this path.
Help Laurel get all of the treasure from this cave.
_"Eureka!  Get as much treasure as you can!"_
Collect at least **3** pieces of treasure to pass this level.
_"Can you help me spot some bugs?"_
This is a new type of puzzle called "Artist". Play with the level and draw something fun.
Help the artist draw this line two times forward.
Draw a line forward five times.
Now, use a `repeat` loop to draw this line five times!
Draw a line seven steps long. This will become our horizon.
Let's put a nice hill in the back.
Use the `repeat` loop to add waves to the water.
We need a ladder up to the boat.
Challenge: Fix the stairs.
Help me put down stones so I don't fall in!
Help me build steps to watch the ship sail away.
The artist saw something funny in the distance.  Draw what you think he saw.
_"Help me get these three tents set up!"_
Can you draw a house? Make it look just the way you like it!
Need a better playlab/events combo
This is a Play Lab level.  Move blocks to the workspace and see what happens!
Jorge the Dog wants to say "Hi there."  Can you help him?
Connect the `move left` block to the `when left` event block that is already in the workspace.
Add blocks for moving right when the `right` button is clicked.
Add events to have Jorge move up and down when the `up` and `down` buttons are pressed.
Make this more interesting by changing the background and playing a random sound when Jorge is clicked.
Add anything you want to this game.  Can you make the dinosaur disappear when Jorge runs into him?
Give everyone something to do when you click on them.
Can you write code to show the rest of my friends? The hints will help you do this project step-by-step.

long_instructions.https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s: _"Play with these blocks and try to get me to the bad pig!"_

_"A bug! Fix the code to get me to the pig."_

[expandable][0]

_"Fix the code to get me to the pig!"_

[expandable][0]

_"Something is not quite right."_ 

REMOVE a block to get the bird to the pig!

[expandable][0]

Try this one yourself from the beginning.

[expandable][0]

Move one way, then another to get the bird to the pig!

[expandable][0]

Figure out what is missing and then add blocks to get the bird to the pig!

[expandable][0]

Solve this level and get the bird to the pig!

[expandable][0]

**Challenge:** Debug this level by adding blocks to get the bird to the pig!

[expandable][0]

**Challenge:** Go around the TNT to get the bird to the pig!

[expandable][0]

Time for a shorter puzzle!  Move one way, then another to get the bird to the pig.

[expandable][0]

Get that pig!

[expandable][0]
Debug this level. Remove the extra blocks, and add the missing blocks. Get the bird to the pig!

**Free Play:** This is Laurel the Adventurer! Move her around and get as much treasure as you can.

Drag blocks into the workspace and try to figure out how to get treasure.  Get at least one item to pass this level.

Get all three piles! Move Laurel to each piece of treasure, then use this block:
  <xml><block type="collector_collect"/></xml>
How can Laurel get all five piles of treasure using only one <xml><block type="maze_moveEast"/></xml> block?

_"Eureka!  Get as much treasure as you can!"_  
(You do not have to get it all.)
_"Can you help me spot some bugs? I know which way I want to go, but I'm not sure how many steps to take."_

Help the artist draw this line two times forward.

[][0]

Our artist is trying to draw a line five times, but can't get it right. Can you help?

[expandable][0]

Now, use a <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown"><title name="TIMES" config="2-6">5</title></block></xml> loop to draw this line five times!

[][0]

## Draw a line seven steps long. This will become our horizon.

[expandable][0]

## Let's put a nice hill in the back.

[expandable][0]

## Use the <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown"><title name="TIMES" config="3-10">???</title></block></xml> loop to add waves to the water.

[expandable][0]

## We need a ladder up to the boat.

[expandable][0]

## **Challenge:** The stairs down to the dock are broken.  Help me fix them.

[expandable][0]

## Time to head back to land. Help me put down stones so I don't fall in!

[expandable][0]

## Help me build steps to watch the ship sail away.

[expandable][0]

The artist saw something funny in the distance.  Draw what you think he saw.

* * *

### Ideas

[][0]
[][1]
[][2]
[][3]

_"Help me get the camp site ready!"_

Use the blocks in the toolbox to draw these three tents.

You can use a loop to draw many lines in a row.

Can you draw a house? Make it look just the way you like it!  Try looking for patterns that repeat!

Here are some ideas:

[][0]

Help Jorge the Dog get moving by connecting the <xml><block type="studio_move">
    <title name="SPRITE">1</title>
    <title name="DIR">8</title>
  </block></xml> block to the <xml><block type="studio_whenArrow">
    <title name="VALUE">left</title>
  </block></xml> event block that is already in the workspace.

Get Jorge to the flag to finish this level!
Now, add more blocks to get Jorge to move right when the right arrow button is clicked.
Add events to have Jorge move up and down when the up arrow and down arrow buttons are pressed.

Give everyone something to do when you click on them. What will the animals say? What else will happen?

In this puzzle, make sure to click for hints. The hints will give you fun things to try!

[][0]

Clicking Olive will make Robin appear! Can you write code to show the rest of the characters too?

In this puzzle, make sure to click for hints! The hints will help you do this project step-by-step!

[][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_maze_seq1_a:
If you are having trouble getting the bird to move, make sure blocks are snapped in place under <xml>
  <block type="when_run"/>
</xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_maze_seq1_b:
The bird will need to move West 3 times to get to the pig. Use this block:

<xml><block type="maze_moveWest"/></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_maze_seq2_a: This program is missing 1 block. Can you figure out which one?
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_maze_seq2_b: Try running the code first to see where the bird ends up. Where do you need to go from there?

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_maze_seq3_a: 1 of the blocks is moving the bird in the wrong direction. Can you figure out which one and replace it with the correct block?
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_maze_seq3_b: Try using the step button to find where the program goes wrong. Is it the 1st step? The 2nd?
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_maze_seq3_c: This <xml><block type="maze_moveNorth"/></xml> block doesn't seem to be moving the bird in the right direction. Can you replace it with a different block?

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_maze_seq4_a: If you are having trouble, try to figure out what the correct path is and then remove the block that doesn't fit.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_maze_seq4_b: Try running the code as it is. Does something go wrong? Which block can you remove? How can you fix it?

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_maze_seq5_a: Try writing down the steps on paper to find a solution!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_maze_seq5_b: You will need 2 blocks, pointing in 2 directions.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_maze_seq6_a: Your final code should have 3 movement blocks.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_maze_seq6_b: If you get stuck, try solving the puzzle in 2 parts, one part before the corner and one part after the corner.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_maze_seq7_a: There is 1 block that you need to add to move the bird to the pig.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_maze_seq7_b: If you can't figure out what to do, try drawing the puzzle on paper and use your finger to figure out which way to move.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_maze_seq8_a: If you're stuck, try drawing the image on paper to see how the bird should move.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_maze_seq9_a: Stuck? Try tracing the bird's path with your finger.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_maze_seq9_b: If you're not sure what to do, try pressing "Start over" and running the code to see what goes wrong.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_maze_seq9_c: You will need to move in 3 directions to solve this puzzle.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_maze_seq10_a: If you're having trouble, try writing down the steps on a piece of paper first.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_maze_seq10_b: You will need to go 3 directions to solve this puzzle.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_maze_seq13_a: If the path you need is unclear, use your finger to trace your way from the bird to the pig.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_maze_seq13_b: Don't be afraid to make a mistake! Try adding blocks and running the code to see what will happen.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_maze_seq13_c: These <xml><block type="maze_moveNorth"/></xml><xml><block type="maze_moveEast"/></xml> blocks will help you move closer to the pig.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_maze_seq_challenge1_a: There are two solutions to this puzzle.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_maze_seq_challenge2_a: Try counting the spaces with your finger. Remember not to count the space where you start!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_collector_loops1_a:
After you have moved to a square with treasure, use this block to pick it up.

<xml>  <block type="collector_collect"/></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_collector_loops1_b: A simple solution would be to move East 2 times, then get the treasure.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_collector_loops2_a: You'll have to move before you can collect any treasure.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_collector_loops2_b:
After you have moved to a square with treasure, use this block to pick it up.

<xml>  <block type="collector_collect"/></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_collector_loops3_a: Try using a <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown"><title name="TIMES" config="3-10">???</title></block></xml> loop!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_collector_loops3_b: Remember, you can put more than 1 block inside a <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown"><title name="TIMES" config="3-10">???</title></block></xml> loop.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_collector_loops4_a: To change how far Laurel goes, change the number of times that the loop runs.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_collector_loops4_b: Don't forget that Laurel needs to walk down and collect the treasure after she finishes the <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown"><title name="TIMES" config="3-10">???</title></block></xml> loop!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_collector_loops5_a: If you can't figure out the answer right away, try using a piece of paper to figure out what arrows you will need and look for a pattern.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_collector_loops5_b: Try splitting the problem into 2 parts, moving sideways and then down.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_collector_loops5_c: You'll want to start with a <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown"><title name="TIMES" config="3-10">???</title></block></xml> loop that moves Laurel west and collects treasure.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_collector_loops6_a: Can't figure out what's wrong? Try running the code a couple of times to see what happens.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_collector_loops6_b: The shortest solution has 2 <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown"><title name="TIMES" config="3-10">???</title></block></xml> loops, one after the other.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_collector_loops7_a: If you can't figure out what comes next, try running the code to see where Laurel ends up.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_collector_loops8_a: If you are having trouble figuring this puzzle out, try writing the moves down on a piece of paper and looking for a pattern.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_collector_loops8_b: Try breaking this puzzle into 3 separate problems, and writing loops for each.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_collector_loops8_c: Remember you can write one piece of the code at a time, then press "Run" to figure out where you need to go from there.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_collector_loops9_a: If you can't spot the best places to use loops, try coding it out step-by-step and look for a pattern.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_collector_loops9_b: Try putting 2 of your <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown"><title name="TIMES" config="3-10">???</title></block></xml> loops inside of another loop to make your code shorter!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_collector_loops_challenge2kp_b: Try this path to get you to a solution.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_collector_loops_challenge2kp_a: Can you use loops to solve this puzzle?

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_collector_loops_challenge1_a: Try changing the numbers in each loop if something seems wrong.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_collector_loops_challenge1_b: You don't need to use a loop if you are only doing something one time.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_collector_loops_challenge1_c: There are 6 gems on the right side of the cave when you start, but you only need to get treasure 5 times moving South. Do you know why?
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_collector_loops_challenge1_d:
The starting program doesn't collect the last 2 gems. Try adding this code at the very end:

<xml><block type="maze_moveEast">
                        <next>
                          <block type="collector_collect_simplified">
                            <next>
                              <block type="maze_moveSouth">
                                <next>
                                  <block type="collector_collect"/>
                                </next>
                              </block>
                            </next>
                          </block>
                        </next>
                      </block></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_artist_loops2_a: Can't figure out how to draw a line?  Start attaching blocks to the <xml><block type="when_run"/></xml> block to see what happens.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_artist_loops2_b: Use this block <xml><block type="simple_move_right"/></xml> to solve this puzzle.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_artist_loops3_a: Trace slowly through the program with your finger to see where it goes wrong.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_artist_loops3_b:
You will want to use a block like this to solve this puzzle.

[][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_artist_loops4_a: If you want the loop to repeat more than 4 times, you can change the number at the top of the block.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_artist_loops4_b:
Since you can only use one <xml><block type="simple_move_right"/></xml>

block, try putting it inside of the <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown"><title name="TIMES" config="2-6">5</title></block></xml> loop.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_artist_loops5_a: Try using what you've learned about <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown"><title name="TIMES" config="3-10">???</title></block></xml> blocks to complete this puzzle!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_artist_loops5_b: If you want the loop to repeat more than 4 times, you can change the number at the top of the block.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_artist_loops5_c:
Since you can only use one <xml><block type="simple_move_right"/></xml> block, try putting it inside of the 

<xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown"><title name="TIMES" config="3-10">???</title></block></xml>

loop.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_artist_loops6_a: Can't figure out how to make the hill?  Try playing with the blocks a bit to see what each one draws.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_artist_loops6_b: You will need 2 blocks in 2 directions to solve this puzzle.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_artist_loops7_a: Can't figure out where to put the loop? Try writing the code step-by-step and look for a pattern.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_artist_loops7_b: Write the code for one wave first, then repeat that to draw the other two.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_artist_loops7_c: Remember you can put more than one block in a <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown"><title name="TIMES" config="3-10">???</title></block></xml> loop.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_artist_loops8_a: Try running the code to see what has been written for you.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_artist_loops8_b: How would you loop the code that has been given to you?
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_artist_loops8_c:
What does the code do?  
What is it supposed to do?  
What does that tell you?

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_artist_loops9_a: Add another block to the code you are given to draw the rest of the stairs.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_artist_loops9_b:
The block you add should go inside of the 

<xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown"><title name="TIMES" config="3-10">5</title></block>
</xml> loop.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_artist_loops9_c: If you can't figure out where to put the loop, try writing your code step-by-step and look for patterns.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_artist_loops_challenge2_a: Blocks like this <xml>  <block type="simple_move_up_left"/></xml> will let your artist move at a slant!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_artist_loops_challenge2_b: When you finish one tent, `jump` up twice to get to the next!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_artist_loops_challenge2_c: All of your blocks will need to be inside of a loop to finish this puzzle.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_playLab_events2_a: Look for a block that makes the dog say something.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_playLab_events2_b:
This is the code you need to complete this puzzle:

<xml>
<block type="when_run" movable="false" deletable="false">
<next>
<block type="studio_saySpriteChoices">
    <title name="SPRITE">1</title>
    <title name="VALUE">Hi there.</title>
  </block>
</next>
</block>
</xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_playLab_events3_a:
Drag this block  <xml><block type="studio_move">
    <title name="SPRITE">1</title>
    <title name="DIR">8</title>
  </block></xml> out and snap it to the bottom of <xml><block type="studio_whenArrow">
    <title name="VALUE">left</title>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_playLab_events3_b: Remember to use the left arrow key to move Jorge to the flag once you have written your program. When the flag turns green, you've finished!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_playLab_events4_a:
Here is the event block that you will need to get Jorge to move right:

<xml><block type="studio_move">
    <title name="SPRITE">1</title>
    <title name="DIR">2</title>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_playLab_events4_b:
This is the code you will need to complete this puzzle:

<xml><block type="studio_whenArrow">
    <title name="VALUE">right</title>
    <next>
  <block type="studio_move">
    <title name="SPRITE">1</title>
    <title name="DIR">2</title>
  </block></next></block></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_playLab_events5_a:
Here are the event blocks that you will need to use to move Jorge up and down:

<xml><block type="studio_whenArrow">
    <title name="VALUE">up</title>
  </block></xml>

and 

<xml><block type="studio_whenArrow">
    <title name="VALUE">down</title>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_playLab_events5_b:
Did you know that you can change the key for  the event arrow by clicking on the picture in the block and choosing a new key?

[][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_playLab_events6_a:
Here is the event block that you would use to have Jorge do something when clicked:

<xml><block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">1</title>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_playLab_events6_b:
Here is the block you would use to change the background:

<xml><block type="studio_setBackground">
    <title name="VALUE">random</title>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_playLab_events6_c:
Here is the block you would use to play a random sound:

<xml><block type="studio_playSound">
    <title name="SOUND">random</title>
  </block></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_playLab_events7_a:
Use this block to control what happens when the actors collide.

<xml><block type="studio_whenSpriteCollided">
    <title name="SPRITE1">1</title>
    <title name="SPRITE2">0</title>
  </block></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_playlab_events_challenge2_a:
You can make a bird sing.

<xml> 
  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">2</title>
    <next>
          <block type="studio_saySprite">
            <title name="SPRITE">2</title>
            <title name="TEXT">Tweet</title>
          </block>
    </next>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_playlab_events_challenge2_b:
You can make a robot beep.

<xml>
  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">6</title>
    <next>
      
          <block type="studio_playSound">
            <title name="SOUND">winpoint</title>
          </block>
        </next>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_playlab_events_challenge2_c:
You can make an angry monster growl.

<xml>  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">5</title>
    <next>
      <block type="studio_setSpriteEmotion">
        <title name="SPRITE">5</title>
        <title name="VALUE">2</title>
        <next>
          <block type="studio_saySprite">
            <title name="SPRITE">5</title>
            <title name="TEXT">Roar!</title>
            <next>
              <block type="studio_setSpriteEmotion">
                <title name="SPRITE">5</title>
                <title name="VALUE">0</title>
              </block>
            </next>
          </block>
        </next>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_playlab_events_challenge1_a:
Make Waddles the Penguin show when you click Robin!

<xml> 
  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">2</title>
    <next>
      <block type="studio_setSprite">
        <title name="VALUE">"visible"</title>
        <title name="SPRITE">3</title>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_playlab_events_challenge1_b:
Make Boo the Ghost show when you click Waddles!

<xml> 
  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">3</title>
    <next>
      <block type="studio_setSprite">
        <title name="VALUE">"visible"</title>
        <title name="SPRITE">4</title>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_playlab_events_challenge1_c:
Make Jayden the Fuzzy Monster show when you click Boo!

  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">4</title>
    <next>
      <block type="studio_setSprite">
        <title name="VALUE">"visible"</title>
        <title name="SPRITE">5</title>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_playlab_events_challenge1_d:

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_playlab_events_challenge1_e:

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_maze_seq1_1: Click the lightbulb when you need a hint!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_maze_seqA_callout1: Use the step button to go step-by-step through the program. This will help you find the bug!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.made_of_stone: These blocks are made of stone.  You can move them, but you can't delete them!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_collector_loops1_1: Do you see some new blocks in the toolbox?  Don't worry, we will show you how to use them later in the stage.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.gradek_adventurer_loops2_1: This number tells you how many of these blocks you can use in this puzzle.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_artist_loops4_1: This number tells you how many of these blocks you can use in this puzzle.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_artist_loops7_1: This number means that only one of this kind of block can be used in the final answer.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_artist_loops8_1: Did you know that you can draw back over a line whenever you need to?

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_playLab_events5_1: Click here to change the direction of the event arrow.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2017/s.courseA_playLab_events6_1: This let's you choose a "random" sound, which means that you don't know what you are going to get until you hear it!
